required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Acute Effects of Squat Protocols in Muscular Power, Postural Sway and Tendinous Thickness.
clinical_study.official_title: Acute Effects of Squat Protocols in Muscular Power, Postural Sway and Tendinous Thickness.
clinical_study.source: Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to know the acute effects of a squat protocol in: 1- lower limb muscle power analyzed by countermovement jump on force platform and upper limb through a bench press with encoder test; 2 - the unipodal postural equilibrium by force platform; 3 - the patellar tendinous thickness measured by ultrasound.

primary_outcome.description: Muscle power of lower limbs measured by countermovement jump on force platform
Tendon thickness of the patellar tendon measured by ultrasound
Monopodal postural balance with open eyes in force platform

secondary_outcome.description: Muscle fatigue measured in each resting period by means of a countermoving jump to assess the loss of power.

arm_group.arm_group_label: As Fast As Possible 100 squat protocol

intervention.arm_group_label: As Fast As Possible 100 squat protocol

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males, with at least a year of experience in heavylift exercises, age between 20 and 35 years.
Exclusion Criteria:
-

overall_official.affiliation: Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia
Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia

reference.citation: Butcher S. J, Judd T. B, Benko C. R, Horvey K. J, Pshyk A. D, (2015). Relative intensity of two types of crossfit exercise: Acute circuit and high-intensity interval exercise. Journal of Fitness Research, 4 (2), 3-15.
Fredberg U, Bolvig L, Andersen NT, Stengaard-Pedersen K. Ultrasonography in evaluation of Achilles and patella tendon thickness. Ultraschall Med. 2008 Feb;29(1):60-5. Epub 2007 Aug 16.

results_reference.citation: Fisker FY, Kildegaard S, Thygesen M, Grosen K, Pfeiffer-Jensen M. Acute tendon changes in intense CrossFit workout: an observational cohort study. Scand J Med Sci Sports. 2017 Nov;27(11):1258-1262. doi: 10.1111/sms.12781. Epub 2016 Oct 7.

Maté-Muñoz JL, Lougedo JH, Barba M, García-Fernández P, Garnacho-Castaño MV, Domínguez R. Muscular fatigue in response to different modalities of CrossFit sessions. PLoS One. 2017 Jul 28;12(7):e0181855. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0181855. eCollection 2017.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Universidad Católica San Antonio de Murcia
